Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 239aa7d705e69d37383df37f6cbb67c0d9425423
Nice, thanks for adding this! We needed to be able to add the D term to the dynamic configuration path also, so this is good.

I am concerned about code duplication here:
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/+/57660/20/pid/buildjson.cpp#144

We need to find some way to merge these common blocks of code, to avoid having to cut-and-paste duplicate code.
Hi Josh, I add a function to replace duplicate codes. Is this in line with your hope? If it's OK, I can replace the same codes in pid/buildjson.cpp in this PR.
Yes, thanks, this looks good now. Please go ahead and also update the similar code in the pid/buildjson.cpp file.

Hi Harvey,
Thanks for adding this for PR-57660.
Do we need to add these properties in entity-manager/schemas/pid.json & pid_zone.json?
I'm not familiar with schemas. But, it seems need to add these properties to EM schemas.
Ok, I will add these properties to EM schemas. Thanks!

Hi Harvey,
Could you help to capitalize the first letter of string "cycleIntervalTimeMS" and "updateThermalsTimeMS" since every first letter of the properties in schemas are capital. Thanks!
I realized this needs to be optional, not mandatory. I made a patch that also contains a similar change: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/+/58797
nit: wording looks odd "add and cycle"

I ended up doing much of the same thing, during my fix here: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/+/59721

I like how your change uses a function to consolidate and minimize the duplicate code, though. Could such a function work for both the old JSON path and the new D-Bus path?

Yes, if doesn't setting these two properties in statis JSON or D-bus config, it will use default value to calculate updateThermalsTimeMS as 1 sec.

Default value:
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/blob/master/conf.hpp#L45-L52

Nice, this looks good and clean. Because of difference of structure types, it's still necessary to have 2 functions, one in the D-Bus path, and another in the old JSON path. This lets each of these 2 functions be used 2 times, however, so it's still some code savings. Have both code paths been tested?
Added test log for static JSON.
Wow, didn't know that you could declare functions with "auto" as the type of the parameter. It's looking like Python 😊
